segments.text: Driving down to the South Coast, thinking of the waves.
Watching the rolling green landscapes against the gray skies, braving the cold wind
Maybe it'll help us wake from winter-brain fall.
Therefore, we step gingerly over a stir.
Pick Nick Mouth, threatening to escape with the tug-of-en-visitable hands.
Back in the office, back to cardboard loyalties, a rainbow-coloured furniture, free-coffee
I'm too wait if I water-cooler into a messy, we work out to play hard.
Public transport helped together with duct tape and patched, returning home to electric bills
Is this really how it turns out to be?
